unhcrreports: Automated Humanitarian Reports

unhcrreports is an R package designed to generate automated humanitarian reports using UNHCR data, ggplot2, and AI-generated narratives. It supports both country-level and regional reports.

Installation

You can install the development version of unhcrreports from GitHub or locally:

# Install from local source
devtools::install(".")

Setup

1. API Keys for AI Summaries

To enable AI-generated narratives, you need to set up an API key for a supported LLM provider. The package supports OpenAI, Google Gemini, Anthropic, and Ollama.

Set your API key as an environment variable. You can do this in your .Renviron file or in your R session:

# For Google Gemini
Sys.setenv(GEMINI_API_KEY = "your_api_key_here")

# For OpenAI
Sys.setenv(OPENAI_API_KEY = "your_api_key_here")

# For Anthropic
Sys.setenv(ANTHROPIC_API_KEY = "your_api_key_here")

2. Using Ollama (Local LLM)

If you prefer to run a local model using Ollama:

  1. Install Ollama: Download from ollama.com.
  2. Pull a Model: Open your terminal and pull a model (e.g., qwen2.5:32b or llama3). bash ollama pull qwen2.5:32b
  3. Configure in R: The package will automatically detect if no API keys are present and try to use a default provider if configured, but for explicit control, you can pass arguments to the generation functions. Note: The current implementation defaults to cloud providers if keys are found.

Usage

Generate a Country Report

To generate a report for a specific country (e.g., Colombia):

library(unhcrreports)

# Render report for Colombia (COL) for the year 2022
render_country_report(
  country_iso3 = "COL",
  year = 2022,
  output_dir = "output"
)

Generate a Region Report

To generate a report for a specific region (e.g., The Americas):

  1. Use the region_report.qmd template.
  2. You can render it using quarto::quarto_render:
library(quarto)

# Define parameters
region <- "The Americas"
year <- 2022

# Render
quarto_render(
  input = system.file("templates", "region_report.qmd", package = "unhcrreports"),
  output_file = paste0("report_", gsub(" ", "", region), "_", year, ".html"),
  execute_params = list(
    region = region,
    year = year
  )
)

Development

  • Verification Scripts: Check dev/verify_report.R and dev/verify_region_report.R for example usage.
  • Tests: Run devtools::test() to run the test suite.
